comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: David Ignatius Walsh (1872-1947) was a United States politician from Massachusetts. As a member of the Democratic Party, he served in the state legislature and then as Lieutenant Governor (1913-1914) and then as the 46th Governor (1914-1916). His first term in the U.S. Senate (1919-1925) was followed by a brief hiatus from government, after which he was elected to the U.S. Senate four times, serving from 1926-1947. On foreign affairs, he was an consistent isolationist, from his early opposition to U.S. domination of the Philippines to opposing Lend-Lease until the attack on Pearl Harbor. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_I._Walsh
